intro: Lophanthus oxyodontus, commonly known as the bearded lophanthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with a distinctive bearded appearance on the stamens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
